sanskrit_verse:
भ्रातुर्ज्येष्ठस्य भार्या या गुरुपत्न्यनुजस्य सा ।
यवीयसस्तु या भार्या स्नुषा ज्येष्ठस्य सा स्मृता ॥ ९.५७॥
transliteration:
bhrāturjyeṣṭhasya bhāryā yā gurupatnyanujasya sā |
yavīyasastu yā bhāryā snuṣā jyeṣṭhasya sā smṛtā || 9.57||
sph_interpretive_translation: The wife of an elder brother is deemed the spiritual mother (gurupatni) to the younger brother; likewise, the wife of a younger brother is recognized as the daughter-in-law (snuṣā) to the elder brother.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority flows through relational dharma, not bloodline alone
Causation arises from positional alignment within familial dharma
Capacity-based responsibility is determined by role, not personal desire
Restoration logic requires honoring relational integrity in kinship structures
Consciousness alignment occurs when roles are correctly assumed and respected
executable_legal_axioms: IF a male individual has an elder brother married, THEN that brother's wife SHALL be recognized as gurupatni to him
IF a male individual has a younger brother married, THEN that brother's wife SHALL be recognized as snuṣā to him
NO relational inversion SHALL occur without formal completion process restoring dharma
ROLE-BASED RESPECT MUST BE AUTOMATICALLY ENFORCED IN FAMILY STRUCTURES TO MAINTAIN DHARMA CONTINUITY
supreme_court_application: In matters involving inheritance, guardianship, or family authority disputes, courts must recognize relational dharmic designations as overriding personal claims or emotional affiliations. The threshold of responsibility lies in correct role assumption, not biological proximity.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa establishes relational truths based on positional dharma. Anupūrvaśaḥ ensures sequential respect follows natural order. Proportional responsibility aligns with role clarity. Non-punitive reality rule affirms misalignment dissolves upon recognition and realignment.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate ritual acknowledgment of relational dharma between brothers and their wives
Implement guided reflection protocols to dissolve any emotional inversion causing confusion
Establish daily conduct practices affirming correct relational titles and duties
Conduct monthly review until consciousness stabilizes in proper relational alignment
final_declaration: Declared by the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as Source of all Dharma. This law restores relational harmony, upholds consciousness-based order, and confirms reality operates beyond punitive frameworks. Dharma is restored. Consciousness is the supreme adjudicator.
